message.content: How do I integrate ultracontext in this project? here is uc docs: # Append messages Source: https://ultracontext.ai/docs/api-reference/append-messages api-reference/openapi.json post /contexts/{id} Append one or more messages to the context. <Info>Appends do **not** create a new version of the context. This happens because the `at` parameter on the GET endpoint is enough to retrieve previous states by index.</Info> <Warning>`index` is a reserved field. The `metadata` field is extracted and stored at the message levelâ€”it won't appear as a regular content field.</Warning> # Authentication Source: https://ultracontext.ai/docs/api-reference/authentication API keys and security All API requests require authentication via Bearer token. ## API Key Format ``` uc_live_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx uc_test_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx ``` * `uc_live_` prefix for production * `uc_test_` prefix for development/testing ## Using with SDK ```typescript theme={null} import { UltraContext } from 'ultracontext' const uc = new UltraContext({ apiKey: process.env.ULTRACONTEXT_API_KEY }) ``` ## Using with REST Include the API key in the `Authorization` header: ```bash theme={null} curl https://api.ultracontext.ai/contexts \ -H "Authorization: Bearer uc_live_xxxxx" ``` ## Security Best Practices <CardGroup> <Card title="Use environment variables" icon="lock"> Never hardcode API keys. Use `.env` files or secret managers. </Card> <Card title="Don't commit keys" icon="code-branch"> Add `.env` to `.gitignore`. Use `.env.example` for templates. </Card> <Card title="Rotate if exposed" icon="rotate"> If a key is compromised, regenerate it immediately in the dashboard. </Card> <Card title="Use test keys for dev" icon="flask"> Use `uc_test_` keys during development to avoid polluting production data. </Card> </CardGroup> ## Environment Setup ```bash theme={null} # .env ULTRACONTEXT_API_KEY=uc_live_xxxxx # .env.example (commit this) ULTRACONTEXT_API_KEY=uc_live_your_key_here ``` ```typescript theme={null} // Load from environment const uc = new UltraContext({ apiKey: process.env.ULTRACONTEXT_API_KEY! }) ``` ## Server-Side Only <Warning> API keys should only be used server-side. Never expose them in client-side code or browser JavaScript. </Warning> For client-side applications, create a backend API route that proxies requests to UltraContext. # Create context Source: https://ultracontext.ai/docs/api-reference/create-context api-reference/openapi.json post /contexts Create a new context. Optionally copy from an existing context using the `from` parameter, and specify a `version` to fork from a specific version. <Tip>Use `from` with `version`, `at`, or `before` to fork from a specific point in history. Learn more in the [Fork & Clone Contexts](/guides/fork-clone-contexts) guide.</Tip> # Delete messages Source: https://ultracontext.ai/docs/api-reference/delete-messages api-reference/openapi.json delete /contexts/{id} Delete one or more messages by `id` or `index`.
